#Text=Q : Who was everyone 's favorite competitor , at any point in the competition ?
#Text=A : We really liked all the talent who made it to the finals .
#Text=They were all good , decent people , who had worked very hard to get where they were at that point in their lives .
#Text=We especially enjoyed all the other young people .
#Text=Our children travelled to New York City with the cloggers ( All That ) for The Today Show and had fun getting to know them better .
#Text=We liked the Millers , Taylor , and Bianca , and became good friends with David and Dania .
#Text=They were very sympathetic when Piers first said to " dump your mum , dad , and little brother .

#Text=I think she loved our rendition of  Amazing Grace " !

column1: #Text=Q : Celtic Spring has performed across both North America and Europe .
#Text=Where have audiences been the most responsive ?
#Text=A : Wherever we have performed , our audiences have loved Celtic Spring .
#Text=Music and dance are a universal language and speak to everyone .
#Text=One of our treasured memories of performing was when we performed in an Italian village for a really enthusiastic crowd with whom we could not speak .
#Text=But they loved our show and afterwards showered us with their treasures : a gold painted horseshoe , poems , books , etc ...
#Text=We were so grateful to be able to bring them joy through our music and dance .
#Text=We also had great fun performing at an all boys boarding school in England .

#Text=Afterwards they showed us all around their school , including the haunted corridors ( if felt like something our of Harry Potter ) and then shared their music with us : a jazz band and madrigals sung at dawn in the tower in the quad to welcome in May Day .
#Text=When we perform we think we are giving something special to our audiences but we are deeply moved by what we get back : happy faces , stories , friendships ...
